comments.raw_text:
It may be faster to have the new Windows service running with some already loaded DLLs in global memory that we usually load from LoadLibrary (which loads from disk).

Firefox could then check in global memory to see if those DLLs are already loaded and load them from memory instead of from disk.

Here's an example library for loading from memory instead of disk:
https://github.com/fancycode/MemoryModule

Perhaps there are other things we also load from disk that we can have already in RAM ready.

Some things will be too big to load in RAM though and we won't want to.
